title: PaperWallet
author: PaperWallet
content: In the course of me posting on this forum, I've had many deleted posts, I never questioned since I don't really care that much.I will though be appealing the deletion of this message just to show an example of what often happens :Quote from: PaperWalletQuote from: Coyster on July 21, 2022, 05:59:26 PMwhat benefit would it be to any of my family member to keep this account when i'm no longer around, a bitcointalk account isn't a 'property', it is just an online account on a platform for discussing Bitcoin and other whatnots.They'll continue getting the dirty FortuneJack money. Just be honest.This message has been posted here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5406723.msg60606086#msg60606086@Coyster posted immediately after my first participation in that thread, so I happened to read his message. I was simply pointing out to that person, contrary to what he is saying, that his account is not "just an online account on a platform for discussing Bitcoin", but also an account that is useful for its holder to get a regular pay, in this case dirty money from FortuneJack.Is this against forum rules? Or am I not allowed to answer some questions? Or, just maybe, criticising the scammer FortuneJack is moderated to some extent.Message back or not, no problem, let the mods do what they want, I am just trying to understand why my message got deleted.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: The reason your post was deleted could be because it is a low quality posts. Is FortuneJack the only campaign on this forum? Also why the use of 'dirty'? If you used campaigns instead of FortuneJack, your post wouldn't have been deleted.Just a question. FortuneJack scammed you? Or you posted like that because Coyster is one of the people that is wearing ForjuneJack signature and avatar? No scam case linked to FortuneJack that I have seen before on this forum, so I believe it is the later reason. So, is your post not worth to be deleted?

comments.author: PaperWallet
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on July 24, 2022, 09:35:44 AMThe reason your post was deleted could be because it is a low quality posts.Ok thks, could be, I understand. "Low quality posts" are censored here.Other suggestions?

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Your post was deleted because it was off-topic in that thread, the thread in question had nothing to do with FJ, thus i see no reason why you'd have them mentioned there, that topic was a discussion about if Bitcointalk accounts are worthy of being inherited or not/if a dead member's account suddenly becomes active, so you didn't manage to stay on the topic, neither were you constructive at all, but that is just by the way.Having said that, i really can't understand what this 'appeal' thread is for (appeal threads are for banned users, and the board for such is in Meta), it was no more than a deleted post, that is something that has happened to every single one of us at one time or the other, for different reasons, some of which we didn't agree with, but it is what it is, we just let it go, and move on like it never happened.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: PaperWallet on July 24, 2022, 09:20:50 AMMessage back or not, no problem, let the mods do what they want, I am just trying to understand why my message got deleted.Someone found it off-topic. They reported it and mod agreed with the report. There are no other case involved.You need to move on from whatever happened between FortuneJack and you. Constantly attacking FJ is not helping you. One of the reason I also see among others is this was an off-topic response, I do not see it has anything to do with the point you are making. I am wondering the topic should me on the meta board.

comments.author: PaperWallet
comments.body: Quote from: Coyster on July 24, 2022, 09:50:04 AMYour post was deleted because it was off-topic in that thread, the thread in question had nothing to do with FJ, thus i see no reason why you'd have them mentioned there, that topic was a discussion about if Bitcointalk accounts are worthy of being inherited or not/if a dead member's account suddenly becomes active, so you didn't manage to stay on the topic, neither were you constructive at all, but that is just by the way.Having said that, i really can't understand what this 'appeal' thread is for (appeal threads are for banned users, and the board for such is in Meta), it was no more than a deleted post, that is something that has happened to every single one of us at one time or the other, for different reasons, some of which we didn't agree with, but it is what it is, we just let it go, and move on like it never happened.ok, I guess it was considered off-topic, I understand, looks like I got my answer. thks.Although it was just an answer to the idea that there is no use for an account to be inherited, and you were talking about you personally, and fortunejack happened to be your avatar. I just answered that question. It wasn't off-topic.I think what has been said is enough. I will lock this topic to avoid unnecessary further comments.
